title: How to Make a Lace Snowball Ornament

steps.headline: Gather the materials for the ornament (they're listed in the Things You'll Need section below).
steps.description: The TiteBond Thick and Quick Glue is found in hardware stores or home improvement stores.If not found there check for it online. Other glues didn't secure the pin or fabric to the ball or grab the material quickly enough to secure the materials to the SmoothFoam ball without extra efforts. The nails are used in place of sewing and/or jewelry pins due to durability and the ease of sticking them into the ball. The other materials can be found in craft or retail shops. The trimming and beads were bought from online.

steps.headline: Make the hanging loop (optional).
steps.description: Take the hairpin, dip it in glue, and push the hairpin firmly into the ball. SmoothFoam Balls usually have a hole on the top of the ball. Dip the ends in glue or push them into or around the hole. This step can be done after inserting all the flowers into the ball; otherwise, the hairpin can get in the way and entangled in open lacy materials. If the ball doesn't have a hole, just get a sharp needle or ice pick and poke it through the foam starting it off. Look for a embossed or engraved circle or a seam.

steps.headline: Measure the length of the strip of lace material needed form one "flower".
steps.description: Create a loop or doughnut on a flat surface. Form it into a complete circle by pinching the sewing region of the material where a thread was intended to sew it to a main material like a dress. It's either on the bottom or the center. Sequins, scallops, and eyelets make measuring easy. Count the number of these and add one or two more for good measure. If the material has layers just form one complete circle at the bottom. When the material forms the desired pompom, flower, or rosette design, cut the remainder of the material off and count the sections. This will be the length of the remaining strips used to create more flowers to cover the ball.

steps.headline: Form the flowers with the material.
Get one nail and place a bead on it.
Attach the flower to the ball.
steps.description: Push the nail with the bead through the center of the flower. Dip nail ends into glue and insert the pin into the ball pressing firmly.

steps.headline: Create more flowers and pin them until the ball is completely covered.
steps.description: Tuck frayed ends under the flower. Match the edges of each flower as closely as possible, pressing the flowers against each other while doing so.

steps.headline: Make and apply the bottom embellishment (optional).
steps.description: Cut a generous length of the red velvet ribbon enough to form a number of loops wanted to make a loop bow. Get a pin, add a bead to it, dip ends in glue, and press this through all the loops and through the foam. Further embellish the ornament as desired with other items. Use these to hide any mistakes and add a finishing touch.

steps.headline: Display the completed ornament!
steps.description: Hang in a doorway, hallway, on a chandelier or Christmas tree. You could also place it in a display bowl or dish display.
